description: Redevelopment (following demolition of Westel House) to provide a mixed-use development of three buildings (Block A - up to 21 storeys: 117sqm of flexible floor space (Use class A1/A3) to ground floor; first to nineteenth comprising 96 residential units and twentieth floor viewing platform; Block B - 9 storeys comprising of affordable residential units; Block C - 9 storeys plus plant comprising hotel (floorspace of 4,634 sqm) and ancillary facilities (Use class C1)) to provide a total of 129 residential units); including new landscaped public realm, children's playspace, basement car parking, cycle parking at basement level and vehicular access off Craven Road via a combined access. Alterations to west side of Craven Road to create one emergency access. Removal of two existing vehicular accesses on Uxbridge Road frontage. Provision of 10 surface parking spaces in connection with approved residential development to the north
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: (PL) 001 B; (PL) 002 C; (PL) 003 G; (PL) 004 D; (PL) 020 B; (PL) 021 B; (PL) 030 C; (PL) 031 E; (PL) 032 B; (PL) 033 B; (PL) 034 D; (PL) 035 B; (PL)110 F; (PL)111 B; (PL)112 B; (PL)113 D; (PL)114 C; (PL)115 C; (PL)116 B; (PL)117 B; (PL)120 B; (PL)121 B; (PL)122 C; (PL)123 C; (PL)130 E; (PL)131 E; (PL)132 C; (PL)133 B; (PL)140 B; (PL)141 D; (PL)210 E; (PL)211 D; (PL)212 A; (PL)213 A; (PL)214 A; (PL)220 A; (PL)221 A; (PL)230 D; (PL)231 D; (PL)232 B; (PL)233 D; (PL)240 A; (PL)310 B; (PL)311 A; (PL)312 A; (PL)320 A; (PL)321 A; (PL)322 A; (PL)323 A; (PL)330 A; (PL)331 A; (PL)332 A; (PL)333 A; and (PL)340 A unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of proper planning and to ensure that the development is implemented in accordance with the approved plans, which have been, assessed against the Council's adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Samples and/or details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development (including privacy screens for balconies and terrace) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials are appropriate for the development, to safeguard the character and appearance of the area and to safeguard the privacy of future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the approved drawings, details including samples of the proposed obscure glazed windows on the northern elevation of Block B shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to the commencement of the development. The windows shall be fitted with obscure glass in accordance with the details shown on the proposed plans prior to the first occupation of Block B, and permanently retained for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring residential development to the north, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the approved drawings, prior to the commencement of the development, full details of any mitigation measures required to ensure that there is no unacceptable loss of privacy to internal rooms within the proposed development shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval. The mitigation measures shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to first occupation of any part of the development and permanently retained for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To safeguard against loss of privacy and overlooking within the development, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 6.7 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, full details of proposed hard and soft landscaping works and all boundary treatment. The details shall include:  -	Detailed planting plans indicating plant species and numbers for all landscaped areas, retained trees and details of the proposed roof terrace and living walls -	Details of hard landscaping, materials and construction specifications  (including tree root protection measures) -	Proposed measures to improve biodiversity -	5-year landscape management plan -	A plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment (walls, fences and gates, carpark shutter, bollards) to be erected  This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters, which have been given in this application. The approved works and management plan shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with a programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and to enhance the biodiversity of the site, in accordance with policies 3.8, 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, full details of the proposed children's play area as identified on the approved plans. The details shall include play equipment, landscaping, boundary treatment (including acoustic fencing), disabled access and security measures and the condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The approved details shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation of any of the residential units hereby approved and retained for the life of the development unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that adequate on-site space for young children to play is provided on site in connection with the proposed residential accommodation, in accordance with policies 3.5, 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 3D.13 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2008). | Notwithstanding the Draft Framework Travel Plan contained within the Transport Assessment submitted with the planning application, a revised Travel Plan, designed to manage the transport needs of residents and visitors, to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced. The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained in operation for the life of the development unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, and to limit the impact of the proposal on local parking conditions, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 21 'Sustainable Transport - Green Travel Plans'. | No development shall taken place until the applicant has secured the implementation of a programme of archaeological work, in accordance with a written scheme of investigation which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved programme unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect any archaeological remains on the site in accordance with policy 4.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the siting, height and nature of a closed circuit television network (CCTV) for the site shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to its installation and the system shall be installed in accordance with the approved details, prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, and thereafter shall not be altered for the life of the development, except with the written permission of the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To provide adequate security within the site whilst safeguarding the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until details of any external lighting associated with the development, is submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall be implemented as approved and retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such details shall meet the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution including:  (i) reducing glare by -	Correctly aiming the luminaires -	Using luminaires with double asymmetric beams designed so that the front glazing is kept at or near parallel to the surface being lit  -	Ensuring that the main beam angle of all lights, directed towards a potential observer is kept below 70 degrees.  (ii)  controlling vertical illuminance with the lights operating to a maximum of 10 lux at ground level and 5 lux at first floor level at any affected facade.  Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of the adjoining occupiers, the character of the area and in the interests of crime prevention and safety, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4, 4.12 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the Noise Assessment submitted with the application, the fitting out of the hotel and ancillary cafT and the and retail/A3 unit shall not take place until full details are submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from any proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding the Noise Assessment report submitted with the application, prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms, gardens, children's play area and balconies from external noise. The details shall also include alternative means of ventilation for noise sensitive rooms. The works shall be completed prior to first occupation and permanently retained for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the development against unacceptable noise and disturbance, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding the Noise Assessment submitted with the application, prior to the commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, of the composite sound reduction index, Rw, for the building envelope of the Energy Centre with windows and doors closed and other means of ventilation provided, the details shall demonstate that the rating noise level at sensitive facades, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, will be lower than the existing background noise level LA90 by at least 5 dBA, during the relevant period of operation. The plant shall be acoustically treated and anti vibration isolated, in accordance with a scheme to be agreed with the Local Planning Authority. The approved insulation shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any part of the development and retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in the writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of existing and future occupiers against unacceptable noise and disturbance via plant noise breakout and through the fabric of the building, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding the Noise Assessment submitted with the application, the fitting out of the hotel kitchens, ancillary cafT and flexible retail/A3 use shall not take place until full details for the installation, operation, and maintenance of the best practicable odour abatement equipment including an extract system, the height of the discharge, and the efflux velocity of the effluent at the point of discharge. The system shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation of the hotel and thereafter retained for the life of the development.  Reason:  To protect the living conditions of the occupiers of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 2.6 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 18 'Places for Eating, Drinking and Entertainment'. | No development shall take place until details of a construction logistics plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:  -	Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site -	Delivery times  -	Proposed on-site construction worker parking -	Dust suppression measures -	Wheel washing provisions -	Site security during construction -	On site storage -	Tree protection -	Construction vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. -	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents -	Details of any temporary vehicular access  The construction logistics plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of construction, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of construction, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.11 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | A delivery and servicing plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved. The plan shall cover the following:  -	Deliveries and collections -	Servicing trips (including maintenance) -	Cleaning and waste removal -	Control of vehicle movements within the internal access road and public realm -	Management and security of underground parking -	Monitoring and review of operations  The delivery and servicing plan shall be implemented on first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the life of the development, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development can be adequately serviced in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety and to safeguard local environmental conditions, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 3C.23 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2008). | Loading and deliveries to the development shall not take place outside the hours of 7.00am - 7.00pm and shall not be carried out directly from Craven Road.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of construction, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards and the 12 proposed wheelchair / wheelchair adaptable residential units detailed on the approved plans shall be provided prior to the first occupation of the building to which they form part.  Such measures shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local planning Authority.   Reason: To increase the proportion of dwellings accessible to people with disabilities in line with the borough's needs, in accordance with policies 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any of the buildings hereby permitted unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the buildings in the interests of visual amenity, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The cafT shown on the ground floor of the proposed hotel building (Block C) shall be ancillary to the approved hotel use (Use Class C1) and shall not operate as a separate planning unit, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure no separate A3 (restaurant) use commences without prior consideration of the planning issues by the Local Planning Authority in the interests of safeguarding the amenities of the locality, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 7.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The A1/A3 use hereby permitted for Block A shall not operate outside the hours of 7:00am - 11:00pm.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of the occupiers of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 4.11 and 7.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The development shall be implemented in accordance with the energy strategy outlined in the Sustainability Statement (as amended) submitted with the planning application unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its energy requirements through the implementation of high-energy efficiency measures and sustainable technologies in accordance with policies 4A.1 and 4A.3 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2008), and polices 2.1 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The proposed provision for refuse and recycling storage for the development shall be provided in accordance with the details shown on the approved drawings prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby permitted, and shall be retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of existing and future occupiers of the area and to safeguard the appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 'Refuse Storage'. | The tree protection measures detailed within the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall be implemented in accordance with the approved document to BS5837 2005 standards during the preparation of the site and the demolition and construction of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To safeguard the existing trees on the site, in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the environment, in accordance with policy 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidance'. | The parking spaces (including disabled parking and active and passive vehicle charging bays) and internal cycle storage areas identified on the approved drawings, shall be marked out/provided on site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and shall be kept continuously available for life of the development and shall not be used for any other purpose unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision and vehicle charging facilities within the site, in accordance with policies 2.9, 4.3, 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the commencement of the development, details (including location and specifications) of on-site nesting box(s) and/or platform(s) designed for Peregrine Falcons shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The box(s)/ platform(s) shall be installed within the development prior to the first occupation of the building to which they form part or the first use of space in which they are contained and shall only be accessible for maintenance. The box(s)/ platform(s) shall be installed strictly in accordance with the details so approved and shall be retained as such for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of biodiversity and nature conservation, in accordance with policies 3.8 and 3.9 of the Council's adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
